sections.title: 3D printed veneers in Shoreham-by-Sea
sections.body: Digitally planned veneers that give you a cost-effective, conservative option when porcelain is not required immediately.
bullets: Scans map veneer thickness and edge transitions
Mock-ups you can review before we finalise
Polishing passes planned for a natural sheen
Discussing when porcelain remains the gold standard

sections.title: Planned fit with clinician oversight
items: Digital design keeps margins and contacts clean
Trial prints help confirm edge length and symmetry
Finishing guided by your bite and lip line
Clear guidance when to step up to porcelain
Regulated dental materials matched to their indication

sections.title: Digitally produced veneers with guided finishing
sections.body: We design veneers from high-resolution scans, print test sets to check comfort and shade, and finish them under clinician direction. Porcelain remains the premium long-term choice, but printed veneers can be a modern, cost-effective step for suitable cases.
bullets: Design informed by your current enamel and bite
Printed mock-ups for review before the final finish
Conservative adjustments to protect natural tooth
Material choices explained with durability expectations
Pathway to porcelain when it best serves longevity

sections.title: Patients seeking a staged or value-led veneer plan
items: People wanting a previewable veneer option before porcelain
Cases where small shape or edge changes are needed
Patients balancing cost with short-to-mid-term goals
Those needing conservative enamel preservation
Patients who want digital check-ins before committing

sections.title: From scan to refined finish
items: Digital consultation and smile capture
Designing veneer thickness and edge curves
Printing and reviewing a mock set
Finishing and tinting to blend with natural teeth
Fit appointment with bite and comfort checks
Maintenance plan and upgrade options when ready
sections.strapline: We outline when printed veneers are appropriate and when a ceramic route may be recommended.

sections.title: Calibrated printing with clinician-led finishing
sections.body: Scans, digital smile design, and controlled printing keep contours consistent. Final shaping and polishing are overseen by the clinical team to protect enamel and comfort.

sections.title: Caring for printed veneers
items: Follow hygiene advice to protect margins and gums
Avoid very hard foods while edges settle
Attend review visits to monitor wear and fit
Understand when porcelain could be advised for longevity
Report any edge lifting or roughness for quick adjustment

sections.title: What to consider before choosing printed veneers

faqs.question: Are printed veneers permanent?
faqs.answer: They can provide a stable result for suitable cases, but we will explain when porcelain remains the long-term standard and plan accordingly.

faqs.question: Can I review the look before committing?
faqs.answer: Yes. We provide digital previews and can print a mock set so you can see length, symmetry, and shade before finalising.

faqs.question: What materials do you use?
faqs.answer: We use regulated dental printing materials selected for the indication. Weâ€™ll explain wear expectations and maintenance needs.

faqs.question: Will my teeth need significant preparation?
faqs.answer: We aim for conservative adjustments. Preparation is guided by digital plans so we preserve as much natural enamel as possible.

faqs.question: When would you recommend porcelain instead?
faqs.answer: If you need maximum longevity, high-load durability, or specific translucency, porcelain may be preferred. We discuss this openly during planning.

sections.title: See if printed veneers suit your goals
sections.body: Book a calm consultation to review digital previews, materials, and whether a staged path to porcelain is right for you.
